SEARCH
Package chess.utils

Class Utils

java.lang.Object
chess.utils.Utils
public class Utils extends Object
Utility class providing common helper methods for chess operations. Includes methods for validating positions, parsing chess notation, and checking if a position exists in a list of positions.

  • Method Details

    • isValidPosition

      public static boolean isValidPosition(Position pos)
      Checks if the given position is within the bounds of an 8x8 chessboard.
      Parameters:
      pos - The Position object to check.
      Returns:
      True if the position is valid on the board, false otherwise.

    • parsePosition

      public static Position parsePosition(String notation)
      Converts standard chess notation (e.g., "E2") to a Position object. Returns null if the notation is invalid.
      Parameters:
      notation - The chess notation string.
      Returns:
      Corresponding Position object, or null if the notation is invalid.

    • containsPosition

      public static boolean containsPosition(List<Position> positions, Position pos)
      Checks if a given position exists in a list of positions.
      Parameters:
      positions - The list of Position objects.
      pos - The Position to check.
      Returns:
      True if the list contains the position, false otherwise.
